<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.03</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Positions </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sets the position of an object relative to the terrain. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object '''setPosATL''' pos </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> pos: [[Array]] - format [[PositionATL]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[setPosATL]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[getPosATL]] [[player]] [[select]] 0, ([[getPosATL]] [[player]] [[select]] 1) - 10, [[getPosATL]] [[player]] [[select]] 2];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[getPosATL]], [[getPos]], [[getPosASL]], [[setPos]], [[setPosASL]]  </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on Feb 26, 2012 - 18:12 (CEST)
<dt class="note">[[User:Lou Montana|Lou Montana]]
<dd class="note"> '''Please Note :''' this command '''demands''' [[PositionATL]] format ; one does not simply give 2D position, as this function won't do anything.
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 11, 2014 - 20:39 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:DreadedEntity|DreadedEntity]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
If you plan on creating bases through script, [[setPosATL]] and [[getPosATL]] will be your friends. Other commands like [[getPos]] or [[getPosASL]] '''will''' return the position relative to any objects that are underneath. I wrote a base building helper script and through multiple tests, I have found that [[getPosATL]] is the absolute best way to get position for objects that are over land.
</dd>
</dl>
